intro: Gynura vitellina, commonly known as the yellow hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The flowers bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
